it.essepuntato.earmark.core
Class PointerRange

java.lang.Object
  it.essepuntato.earmark.core.Range
      it.essepuntato.earmark.core.PointerRange
All Implemented Interfaces:
EARMARKChildNode, EARMARKItem, EARMARKNode, java.lang.Cloneable
public class PointerRange
extends Range

This class represents a concrete pointer range in the EARMARK model.

Author:
Silvio Peroni

Constructor Detail

PointerRange

protected PointerRange(EARMARKDocument d,
                       Docuverse docuverse,
                       java.lang.Integer begin,
                       java.lang.Integer end,
                       java.net.URI id)
Create a pointer range.

Parameters:
d - the document to which this item is associated.
docuverse - the docuverse the range refers to.
begin - the begin non-negative integer point (if negative, it consider its absolute value) of the range.
end - the end non-negative integer point (if negative, it consider its absolute value) of the range.
id - the identifier for the new range.

The integer point in which the range begins.

public java.lang.Integer ends()

Overrides:
ends in class Range
Returns:

getTextContent

public java.lang.String getTextContent()

This method retrieves the textual content of the range, considering the document content as a string and then restricting it according to the begin and end locations.

If the begin and/or end locations are not specified (i.e., = null), then this method considers location "0" as begin and location "size(docuverse_content)" as end.

Returns:
the textual content of the range.

getNodeType

public EARMARKNode.Type getNodeType()
Description copied from interface: EARMARKNode
A code representing the type of the underlying earmark node.

Returns:
a code among those defined above.

clone

public Range clone()
Description copied from class: Range
This method returns a new range initialised with an identifier different from the calling range one. Moreover, the cloned range will refer to a new docuverse containing only the content returned from the calling range by the method getTextContent.

Specified by:
clone in class Range
Returns:
a new range with the same textual content of the calling one.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class Range
